>
[Blade Byrnie](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1843)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 15 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Armor** [Chain Shirt](/Armor.aspx?ID=6)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Instead of chain links, this _+1 [chain shirt](/Armor.aspx?ID=6)_ is assembled from metal “leaves” that each resemble a small blade.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645))    **Effect** You pull a link from the armor, which transforms into a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_. The dagger disappears and reappears as a link in the armor after you Strike with it, or at the end of this turn if you don't make a Strike. You can Activate the blade byrnie in place of an Interact action to draw a weapon for abilities such as the [Quick Draw](/Feats.aspx?ID=498) feat.

 Upgrading the runes on the _blade byrnie_ makes the daggers pulled from it more powerful. The daggers have a [_+2 weapon potency_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=281) rune if the armor has a [_+2 armor potency_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=278) rune, or a _+3 weapon potency_ rune if the armor has a _+3 armor potency_ rune.
